summary: A step-by-step guide to using OBS Studio to improve video and audio quality for video conferencing, presented by Tom Antos.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a black screen that transitions to a circular frame featuring a man in a suit and bow tie, holding a camera, set against a dark background with a subtle light flare. The scene then shifts to a Zoom meeting interface, where a man in a blue shirt appears in a warmly lit room adorned with string lights and shelves filled with various objects. The text 'Improved Zoom Video' is displayed at the top, and 'TOMANTOSFILMS.COM' is shown at the bottom. The man speaks directly to the camera, with the interface showing options like 'Security,' 'Participants,' 'Chat,' 'Share Screen,' 'Record,' and 'Reactions.' The video then transitions to a CNN Business webpage titled 'WORK TRANSFORMED,' discussing how tech companies are allowing employees to work from home through 2020. The next frame shows a Washington Post article with the headline 'Big Tech was first to send workers home. Now it's in no rush to bring them back,' featuring an image of Google's office entrance. The video continues with another Washington Post article titled 'Twitter, Facebook, and Google are all letting employees work from home through 2021,' accompanied by an image of a man in a suit. The final frame displays a Vault article titled '4 Reasons Top Tech Firms Told Employees to Work from Home Until 2021,' with a sign reading 'OPENING PRO VERY SOON!' in the background. Throughout the video, the focus remains on the man in the blue shirt, the Zoom interface, and the various articles discussing remote work policies in the tech industry.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker introducing a topic about improving live video teleconferencing using programs like Zoom or Skype. He speaks in a casual, informative tone. He notes how remote work has become more common and that companies are seeing the benefits of remote video conferencing.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a woman in a gray tank top and blue shorts performing a workout routine on a wooden deck, accompanied by a small white dog. The scene transitions to a close-up of an ASUS laptop screen displaying a video of a person doing a similar workout in a hallway. The woman continues her workout on the deck, with the dog watching her. The video then shows the laptop screen again, this time with a different person doing a workout in a room. The woman on the deck continues her routine, and the video cuts back to the laptop screen, showing another person doing a workout in a hallway. The video then shows a man in a blue shirt sitting in a conference room, watching a Zoom meeting on a large screen. The video concludes with a close-up of the Zoom meeting screen, showing a group of people in a meeting room. Throughout the video, the focus is on the woman's workout routine and the various people doing workouts on the laptop screen, highlighting the use of technology for fitness and virtual meetings.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a single male speaker, discussing how a woman uses Zoom for an exercise club. He describes the convenience of the virtual connection but expresses frustration with the audio quality, specifically concerning the teacher needing to be heard and music being played for the students to exercise. His tone is conversational and slightly annoyed. He then transitions to a promise to share a simple upgrade to improve the quality.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a display of the OBS Studio website, showcasing its latest release and download options for Windows, macOS, and Linux. The website highlights OBS Studio as free and open-source software for video recording and live streaming. The scene transitions to the OBS Studio interface, where a user navigates through the software, adding a webcam source and adjusting settings. The user, wearing a blue shirt, is seen in a room with a television, shelves, and a ceiling light. The OBS Studio interface shows various controls and options for audio and video settings. The user then adds a video source, displaying a split-screen effect with the text "FILMMAKING TIMES" and a "LIVE! with Tom Antos" graphic. The video concludes with the user holding a camera rig, continuing to adjust settings and prepare for a live stream.
events_list.audio_caption: A male speaker with a knowledgeable tone introduces OBS Studio as a free open-source program for live streaming, suggesting downloading it and creating a scene. He outlines the process of adding a video capture device and selecting the webcam, emphasizing improving the video by adding relevant graphics or promoting products, which can be achieved by adding an image, slideshow, or video. He concludes by highlighting the greater flexibility of OBS compared to Zoom and recommends consulting the numerous online tutorials available.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a blue shirt, who appears to be in a home studio environment, surrounded by various pieces of equipment and decorations, including a film reel and string lights. He is seen speaking directly to the camera, with a graphic overlay displaying the text "TOMANTOSFILMS.COM" and an image of a person holding a camera. The man gestures with his hands, including a thumbs-up, while discussing the setup and equipment used in filmmaking. The video includes close-up shots of a professional camera with a lens, a camera rig, and a small device labeled "Full HD Video Capture USB 3.0 to HDMI." The man also demonstrates the use of a software interface, showing a dropdown menu with options related to camera settings and a pop-up window titled "Properties for Canon," which includes settings for the camera's resolution and frame rate. The video concludes with a shot of a lighting setup, featuring a large softbox light, and the man continues to speak, providing insights into the technical aspects of video production.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker describing ways to improve video quality, suggesting a video camera and HDMI video capture device over a built-in webcam, adding that in OBS, you can select your video capture device as a source, adding a large light to improve the result, speaking in an informative tone. He goes on to say that video is only as good as the audio. Next, a low-frequency humming sound is heard.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man in a blue shirt holding two small white devices labeled 'INDEX' and 'INDEX' in front of a camera, with a background featuring shelves with various items and string lights. The text 'TOMANTOSFILMS.COM' is displayed at the bottom of the screen. The man then holds a small black device, possibly a microphone, and continues to speak. The scene transitions to an outdoor deck where a woman in a purple tank top and patterned leggings dances with a small white dog. The deck is surrounded by trees and has outdoor furniture, including chairs and a swing. The video then shows a close-up of a laptop screen displaying a video of the woman dancing indoors, with a water bottle and a smartphone visible on the table next to the laptop. The video returns to the outdoor deck, where the woman continues to dance with the dog, and concludes with the man in the blue shirt holding the small black device and speaking, with the same background of shelves and string lights. The text 'TOMANTOSFILMS.COM' remains displayed throughout the video.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a single male speaker advising on how to improve audio quality, stating that it is important to "use a microphone that is closer to the presenter's mouth," noting that the "quality of the audio will right away suffer" when using a built-in webcam microphone and stepping away from the laptop. He continues discussing the drawbacks of listening to the incoming audio on laptop speakers, saying that "that may create feedback, echo, and just background noise," especially with background music for the presentation.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a blue shirt, sitting in a cozy room adorned with string lights and shelves filled with various items, including a clock and decorative objects. He is engaged in a video editing session using Adobe Premiere Pro, as indicated by the interface visible on the screen. The text 'TOMANTOSFILMS.COM' is prominently displayed at the bottom of the screen, suggesting the man's affiliation with a film or video production company. The man appears to be explaining or demonstrating something related to the editing process, as he interacts with the software and occasionally looks at the camera. The video transitions to a close-up of a pair of black wireless earbuds labeled 'Tribit' in their charging case, placed on a wooden surface. The man then navigates through the settings menu on his computer, selecting 'Add a device' and choosing 'Bluetooth' to connect the earbuds. The video editing interface remains visible in the background throughout these actions. The man continues to work on the video editing software, with various windows and panels open, indicating a detailed and focused editing process. The video concludes with the man still engaged in the editing process, with the 'TOMANTOSFILMS.COM' text and the editing interface consistently visible, reinforcing the professional and creative atmosphere of the video production environment.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing using bluetooth earbuds as a solution. He mentions using earbuds from a specific brand with a long-lasting battery and no audio delays. He explains how to connect them to a laptop using Bluetooth and adjust the settings in the audio mixer section. Finally, he tells the listener to select their headphones in the device settings. The clip ends with a sudden sound.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a close-up of two white RODE microphones on a wooden surface, one connected to a red cable. A hand picks up the unconnected microphone, revealing blue indicator lights. The scene transitions to a person in a blue shirt speaking into a microphone, with a cozy background featuring string lights and shelves. The video then shows a laptop with a red cable plugged into its headphone jack, followed by a person assembling a microphone setup on a wooden table, including a RODE microphone, a coiled red cable, and a furry windscreen. The person is seen speaking into the microphone again, with the text "TOMANTOSFILMS.COM" displayed on the screen. The video concludes with the person opening a 'Create New Source' window on a video editing software interface, indicating the process of adding a new audio source to the project.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker discussing audio quality, specifically mentioning the "Road Wireless Go" clip-on microphone and how it can improve audio quality. He also touches on plugging the receiver into a laptop's microphone jack, and the use of an audio splitter cable for laptops with a combined mic/headphone jack. The speaker then mentions how to select this microphone in OBS settings instead of the webcam or headphones.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a computer screen displaying a music selection interface, showcasing various albums and artists such as "Fresh" by LIOWYDO and "Maya Pacziga." The interface features a dark theme with a prominent "PLAY" button and a waveform visualization of the selected track, "Rowing at the Moon" by DJ Pius. The scene transitions to a person wearing a blue shirt, sitting in a room adorned with string lights and shelves filled with decorative items. The individual appears to be engaged in a video editing process, as indicated by the editing software interface visible at the bottom of the screen, displaying tracks and editing tools. The text "TOMANTOSFILMS.COM" is prominently displayed across the screen, suggesting a promotional or branding element. The video maintains a consistent focus on the person and the editing software, emphasizing the creative process in a cozy, well-lit environment.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a single male speaker discussing how to add background music to OBS. He explains playing music on a laptop from a website to listen in headphones while making adjustments. He also describes adjusting the volume for the audience separately in the audio mixer section, and adjusting the slider, speaking in a clear and informative tone.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man wearing a blue shirt, sitting in a warmly lit room adorned with string lights and shelves filled with various items, including a clock and decorative objects. He appears to be speaking, as indicated by his hand gestures and facial expressions. The scene is overlaid with a video editing software interface, displaying a timeline and various editing tools, suggesting that the video is being recorded or edited. The text "TOMANTOSFILMS.COM" is prominently displayed across the center of the screen, accompanied by a small image of a person holding a camera, indicating the creator's branding. The video then transitions to a webpage from the OBS project website, showcasing the OBS-VirtualCam 2.0.4 plugin. The webpage provides details about the plugin, including its version, supported OBS versions, and download options. A notification on the page warns that this version of the plugin is deprecated and should not be used with OBS Studio 2.5, directing users to an alternative version. The video maintains a consistent focus on the webpage, emphasizing the importance of the information provided.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker introducing a topic: transferring a presentation to a program like Zoom, mentioning the need for a virtual camera plugin and audio cable. The speaker then directs the listener to the video description for download links. The clip concludes with instrumental music.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a computer screen displaying a file explorer window where a user is saving a file named "OBS Studio VirtualCam Installer.exe" to the "Downloads" folder. The file explorer window is open on a Windows operating system, and the user is in the process of saving the file. The background shows a web browser with a webpage open, displaying a message about a deprecated plugin version and a link to a newer version. The user then navigates to the VB-Audio Software website, which features a download section for the VB-CABLE Virtual Audio Device. The website provides options to download the driver for Windows and Mac, along with a brief description of the software's functionality. The user scrolls through the website, revealing more information about the software, including its use for connecting two applications together, such as a player to a recorder. The video concludes with the user still on the VB-Audio Software website, with the download options and descriptions visible on the screen.
events_list.audio_caption: A male speaker gives instructions, in a casual tone, for setting up virtual camera and audio software. The speaker begins by describing how to download and install the virtual camera, mentioning that you should restart OBS afterward. He then switches to describing the virtual audio cable, recommending the free VB-cable driver and explaining that the paid versions are not necessary. He concludes by advising listeners to install the program and then restart their computer to ensure the drivers load correctly.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a view of a computer screen displaying a webpage for Virtual Audio Cable, featuring download options for Windows and macOS. The scene transitions to a person wearing a blue shirt, sitting in a room adorned with string lights and shelves filled with various items, including a clock and decorative objects. The person appears to be engaged in a video editing process, as indicated by the video editing software interface visible on the screen, which includes a timeline and various editing tools. The text "TOMANTOSFILMS.COM" is prominently displayed at the bottom of the screen, suggesting the person is associated with this website. The video editing software interface shows a dropdown menu labeled "Virtual Audio Cable," with options such as "Submix," "Submix Input," "Submix Output," "Target Audio Input," and "Target Audio Output." The person seems to be selecting or configuring audio settings within the software. The video maintains a consistent focus on the person and the editing process, with the background and lighting remaining unchanged throughout the sequence.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker providing instructions. He tells the listener to "click tools" and "select virtual cam," suggesting a tech tutorial or guide. He mentions adjusting settings or leaving them on default and then picking the first camera option and clicking "start." The speaker then says to close the window.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a person wearing a blue shirt, sitting in a room adorned with shelves and string lights, creating a cozy atmosphere. The individual is focused on a computer screen displaying a video editing software interface, specifically Adobe Premiere Pro. The screen shows various settings and options for audio and video editing, including a timeline with multiple tracks and a preview window. The person appears to be adjusting settings and navigating through the software, with the interface displaying options such as 'General,' 'Output,' 'Audio,' and 'Video.' The video editing software interface is detailed, with numerous settings and options visible, including 'Source Alignment Smoothing,' 'Source Smoothing,' and 'Projection.' The person continues to interact with the software, making adjustments to the settings and navigating through different sections of the interface. The video editing software interface is shown in detail, with options such as 'Language,' 'Output,' 'Audio,' and 'Video' visible. The person is seen making adjustments to the settings, including 'Source Alignment Smoothing,' 'Source Smoothing,' and 'Projection.' The interface also displays various audio and video tracks, with the timeline and preview window visible. The person continues to interact with the software, making adjustments to the settings and navigating through different sections of the interface. The video editing software interface is shown in detail, with options such as 'Language,' 'Output,' 'Audio,' and 'Video' visible. The person is seen making adjustments to the settings, including 'Source Alignment Smoothing,' 'Source Smoothing,' and 'Projection.' The interface also displays various audio and video tracks, with the timeline and preview window visible. The person continues to interact with the software, making adjustments to the settings and navigating through different sections of the interface. The video editing software interface is shown in detail, with options such as 'Language,' 'Output,' 'Audio,' and 'Video' visible. The person is seen making adjustments to the settings, including 'Source Alignment Smoothing,' 'Source Smoothing,' and 'Projection.' The interface also displays various audio and video tracks, with the timeline and preview window visible. events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a single speaker, delivering instructions in a calm, instructional tone, saying things like "under the settings, go to audio and in advanced selection" and guiding someone through specific steps related to audio settings, directing them to "select cable input" and "advanced audio properties". The speaker continues, advising on channel settings, mentioning "monitor and output", and addressing scenarios involving background music and desktop audio, ultimately concluding with a final direction.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man with a beard and mustache, wearing a blue shirt, participating in a Zoom meeting. Initially, he is seen adjusting his microphone settings, with a pop-up window displaying options for selecting a microphone and speaker. The background reveals a room with a film reel and other equipment, suggesting a creative or technical workspace. The man then proceeds to select a camera, with a pop-up window showing options for HD Webcam, OBS Camera, and other virtual camera options. The video concludes with the man in a different setting, where the background is decorated with string lights and shelves filled with various items, creating a cozy atmosphere. A text overlay at the bottom of the screen reads "TOMANTOSFILMS.COM," indicating a promotional or branding element related to the content creator. Throughout the video, the man maintains a neutral expression, focusing on the technical aspects of the Zoom meeting setup.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a single speaker, instructing how to configure Zoom with OBS, starting with "Start up Zoom", guiding the listener through microphone and camera settings. The tone is instructional and clear. The speaker explains to select "Cable Output VB Audio Virtual Cable" to route sound from OBS into Zoom, and then to select "OBS Camera" for the video feed. The speaker concludes by stating that whatever video presentation in OBS will appear in Zoom as the webcam.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man with a beard and wearing a blue shirt is seen participating in a Zoom meeting. The background is decorated with string lights and shelves holding various items, creating a cozy atmosphere. The text "TOMANTOSFILMS.COM" is prominently displayed at the bottom of the screen, indicating the website associated with the meeting. The man appears to be speaking and gesturing with his hands, occasionally looking at the camera. At one point, he holds up a small black object, which he opens to reveal its contents, possibly to demonstrate or explain something to the audience. The overall setting suggests a casual yet professional environment, likely for a discussion or presentation related to the website mentioned.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker explaining that programs like Skype allow you to select your microphone and webcam, similar to Zoom. He then says, "That's it, you're ready to do your pro looking and sounding video conference." The clip concludes with one word that is cut off.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a split-screen view with a person on the left side, wearing a blue shirt, and a Zoom meeting interface on the right. The background of the person includes shelves with various items and string lights, creating a cozy atmosphere. The text "TOMANTOSFILMS.COM" is prominently displayed at the bottom of the screen. The person appears to be speaking, as indicated by their mouth movements and hand gestures. The Zoom meeting interface shows options like "Stop Video," "Security," "Participants," "Chat," "Share Screen," and "End Meeting." The person's name, "Tom Jones," is visible at the top of the Zoom interface. The video editing software interface on the left side of the screen shows various editing tools and settings, including audio levels and video effects. The video progresses with the person continuing to speak, and the Zoom interface remains unchanged. The video editing software interface also shows a file selection window, indicating that the person is likely editing or preparing to edit the video. The video concludes with a countdown sequence displayed on the screen, starting from 10 and counting down to 6, with the person still visible on the left side of the screen.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a single male speaker, who explains that the use of OBS enables customization of audio and video for presentations. He then lists examples of scenes with different graphics, video clips, or demos, concluding that it can be as elaborate or as simple as desired. The speaker's tone is informative and conversational.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a countdown sequence, starting from the number 3 and transitioning to 2, then 1, and finally 0, displayed in bold yellow font against a black background. This countdown is shown in a video editing software interface, with various editing tools and timelines visible. Following the countdown, the word "LEARN" appears in white text on a light blue background, accompanied by a colorful circular graphic. The scene then shifts to a blue background featuring a white square with vertical bars, resembling an equalizer, and the text "FILM MAKING LIVE" along with the website "TOMANTOSFILMS.COM" in white font. The video then transitions to a person wearing a blue shirt, standing in front of a shelf adorned with various items and string lights, with the text "TOMANTOSFILMS.COM" displayed at the bottom of the screen. The person appears to be speaking, as indicated by their mouth movements and facial expressions. The video maintains a consistent background and lighting throughout, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker advising listeners to "look up one of the many free OBS studio tutorials online."  He continues in a positive and encouraging tone, expressing hope that listeners will improve the quality of their video conferences, then bids farewell. Finally, the speaker concludes with a simple "bye."

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a split-screen view of a man in a cozy room, surrounded by shelves adorned with various items and string lights, creating a warm atmosphere. The man, who has a beard and is wearing a dark shirt, appears to be speaking, as indicated by his mouth movements and the presence of a microphone. The text "TOMANTOSFILMS.COM" is prominently displayed across the screen, suggesting that this is a promotional or informational video related to the mentioned website. The left side of the screen shows a video editing software interface, indicating that the video is being edited or prepared for editing. The right side of the screen displays a simple graphic with a blue and red paint splash, possibly representing a logo or a visual element related to the content. The video then transitions to a series of black frames, indicating a possible fade-out or a pause in the video, with no visible content or actions occurring during these frames.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with the distinct sound of speech, seemingly from a male speaker. Following this, a piece of funk music starts to play. The main instruments of the funk track include bass guitar and electric guitar, and drums.
